DOC.brief_title: Treatment Female Stress Urinary Incontinence : Study Comparing Two Suburethral Slings , Retropubic Approach ( TVT ) Trans-Obturator ( TVT-O ) Approach
DOC.detailed_description: Urinary stress incontinence ( USI ) frequent pathology woman . Surgical treatment require 30 50 % woman present USI . Several surgical technique currently available . At present time , placement suburethral sling one efficient technique . Furthermore , placement suburethral sling know associated low rate complication . Currently , two approach available placement suburethral sling : retropubic approach ( TVT ) trans-obturator approach ( TVT-O ) . The efficacy two approach seem equivalent . However , morbidity relate two technique probably different . In retrospective study , retropubic approach associate high rate bladder perforation . On hand , trans-obturator approach suppose associate high rate post-operative pain . Thus , purpose study compare efficacy morbidity follow placement two type suburethral sling woman present stress urinary incontinence : TVT TVT-O .
DOC.criteria: Woman 18 year old Clinical diagnosis stress urinary incontinence require surgical management Must able read sign consent Pregnancy Anticoagulant treatment Isolated overactive bladder syndrome Genital prolapse require surgical treatment Concomitant hysterectomy
